commit_message:
Better exception handling for deletes during build

To retain parity with the current run_instance boot process we should
not set the instance to ERROR if a delete occurs while it's building.

Some instance updates were moved into try/except blocks so the
task_state check failures are handled properly.  And a test for a
condition that can't occur was removed.

Part of bp remove-cast-to-schedule-run-instance

Change-Id: I688059404d6b697bd21f6037252dbe628c1b24f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/57497/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.UnexpectedTaskStateError as e: # The instance is deleting, so clean up but don't error. with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): self._notify_about_instance_usage(context, instance, 'create.end', extra_usage_info={'message': e.format_message()}) except exception.UnexpectedTaskStateError as e: if e.kwargs.get('actual') == task_states.DELETING: # Reraise since this exception won't set an error state. raise raise exception.BuildAbortException(instance_uuid=instance['uuid'], reason=e.formate_message()) except exception.UnexpectedTaskStateError as e: if e.kwargs.get('actual') == task_states.DELETING: # Reraise since this exception won't set an error state. raise raise exception.BuildAbortException(instance_uuid=instance['uuid'], reason=e.formate_message())
deleted_lines: except exception.BuildAbortException: self._cleanup_allocated_networks(context, instance, requested_networks) self._set_instance_error_state(context, instance['uuid']) except exception.UnexpectedTaskStateError as e: self._notify_about_instance_usage(context, instance, 'create.end', extra_usage_info={'message': e.format_message()}) raise

subject: Adds a retry mechanism when deleting containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-03 20:19:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/e51b69f9d22fb4a2e72a164cb015fcda7c614ed6', 'message': 'Adds a retry mechanism when deleting containers

Container server now has a mechanism to retry deleting a container
when it fails because the container still has objects. This can be useful
in bulk a bulk delete where you delete all the objects in a container
and then try to delete the container. It is very likely that at the
end it will fail because because the replica objects have not been
deleted by the time the middleware got a successful response.

Change-Id: I1614fcb5cc511be26a9dda90753dd08ec9546a3c
Closes-Bug: #1253478

in bulk a bulk delete where you delete all the objects in a container
and then try to delete the container. It is very likely that at the
end it will fail because because the replica objects have not been
deleted by the time the middleware got a successful response.

Change-Id: I1614fcb5cc511be26a9dda90753dd08ec9546a3c
Closes-Bug: #1253478
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-10 18:41:36.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/bulk.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_bulk.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/96c9ff56fa211c04aa7e898797eedfb487b8e261', 'message': 'Adds a retry mechanism when deleting containers

commit_message:
Adds a retry mechanism when deleting containers

Bulk middleware now has a mechanism to retry a delete when the
HTTP response code is 409. This happens when the container still
has objects. It can be useful in a bulk delete where you delete
all the objects in a container and then try to delete the container.
It is very likely that at the end it will fail because the replica
objects have not been deleted by the time the middleware got a
successful response.

Change-Id: I1614fcb5cc511be26a9dda90753dd08ec9546a3c
Closes-Bug: #1253478
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/20/59820/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .IP \fBallow_delete_retry\fR Enables retries to delete a container that still has objects. This can be useful when doing a bulk delete of all the objects in a container and then trying to delete the container at the end. The last will frequently fail because it is very likely that all replicated objects have not been deleted by the time the middleware got a successful response. The default is False. .IP \fBdelete_retry_count\fR Times to retry a container delete. The default is 3. .IP \fBdelete_retry_interval\fR Time to wait between container deletes. The default is 1 second.

associated tests.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

commit_message:
Set include_service_catalog to False

include_service_catalog is a parameter in swift authtoken configuration.
Set to False improves performances.

Closes-Bug #1257738
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

Change-Id: Ie5dd2de45fce79e4da7ccb5b37d7c69ee1cb5198
(cherry picked from commit 2fc0354936bd89889f2e37f92e2a4acb501ca785)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/21/65321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make nova preserve state in /mnt/state

This does not move config files, only nova's data files. We need this to
support separation of readonly root partition and a long living
preserved state partition.

Change-Id: I878e3cb57607ff72d8f1bf60a3828cf06a3feeb7

commit_message:
Tox fails to build environment because of MySQL-Python

The last version of MySQL-Python (>=1.2.4) needs the lib mysqlclient to
work. This patch adds a comment in the global-requirements to inform
Administrators. They have to install this library.

Change-Id: Iac1038f673efc035bca9ec703d6293c8cefae58c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/28/62028/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MySQL-python==1.2.3

commit_message:
Handle "inf" message in RAM limit chart

It captures byte value should be infinite to display a text message to
the user. The message displayed is the same as shown in the other
charts in the event that they also have infinite value.

Change-Id: I5686f3bdf7d0661b1761522fe376e289aff657ed
Closes-Bug: #1237350

Change-Id: I6c9a45114afbfa99ea2d01a3f682a0dc78a72530
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1266418
'}]
commit_message:
Updates single flat use-case example for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora

Adds specific configuration options for RHEL, CentOS and Fedora
based distributions which were missing - e.g. the guide presumed
RabbitMQ was in use despite it not being relevant for these
platforms. In addition it adds clarity on where to find further
information or how to complete a specific step where necessary,
something the existing implementation lacked.

Now uses openstack-config in RHEL and SUSE based platforms.

Change-Id: I6c9a45114afbfa99ea2d01a3f682a0dc78a72530
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1266418

commit_message:
Reduce visibility of task_action

Task action is an internal to the action
engine init and runtime and shouldn't
become part of the public api of the action
engine type.

Change-Id: I68a10a83718f70cc037e7aaa9259c7bfdc9b93a4

commit_message:
Consider  @,! in properties protection rule as a configuration error

In roles based property protection, if '@' and '!' are in the same rule then the
glance api will not start considering this an Invalid Configuration.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1260333

Change-Id: I1d304f5c505ae9e2486ff653dda205fc2d851c2b

commit_message:
neutron-rootwrap-xen-dom0 handles data from stdin

The neutron-rootwrap-xen-dom0 script and the netwrap plugin have been
modified to pass stdin from one to the other.

Change-Id: Ie97980873ed95f2c96eb68f8de611de1a733b130
Closes-Bug: #1259748

commit_message:
Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables db2 as well.

Oslo version in change I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503

Partial-Bug: #1231657
Change-Id: Icc032b2ebecf820a352c12330d6dd673c8655998

as target, it is cleared at the end of the except clause. (...) Exceptions are
cleared because with the traceback attached to them, they form a reference

next garbage collection occurs."

commit_message:
Minor Python 3 fixes

basestring does not exist anymore in Python 3: use six.string_types instead.

In "try: .../except Exception as err: ...", err is a local variable, it does no
more exist after the except block. Copy the exception in a new cls_error
variable to fix Python 3 support.

Extract of Python 3 documentation: "When an exception has been assigned using
as target, it is cleared at the end of the except clause. (...) Exceptions are
cleared because with the traceback attached to them, they form a reference
cycle with the stack frame, keeping all locals in that frame alive until the
next garbage collection occurs."

http://docs.python.org/3.3/reference/compound_stmts.html#try

Change-Id: I2efb14b3838f78d1ed5e09b3ccd4e796a3448aee

commit_message:
Fix exception deserialiation on Python 3

Builtin exceptions are now in the builtins module, the exceptions module has
been removed.

Fix also the unit test for tracebacks, Unicode representation doesn't start
with "u" prefix anymore (u'...').

Change-Id: I422be457e23066699950c9a3999878ecf65f1b3f

commit_message:
Modify default prefix for solidfire account

The SolidFire driver creates a unique account at volume
creation composed of <cinderhost-tenantID>.This is fine
until one tries to implement HA Cinder or moves their
Cinder node to another machine.

This patch changes the default setting to be an empty string
(ie no prefix), but still allows backward compatability by setting
the config option to 'hostname'.

DocImpact: Changes default for account-prefix, for backwards compatability
use the non-default 'hostname'

commit_message:
Fix check_nvp_config erroneous complaint

Add the missing ingredient to the boolean test. This is
not a straight cherry-pick from a trunk fix, as the
utility tool has been renamed in Icehouse.

Closes-bug: #1265353

commit_message:
Remove copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.

Closes-Bug: #1262424
Change-Id: I22d5881537cff120ae10b2fb3141c427d621214b

commit_message:
initialize eventlet for tests

Some tests are succeededing but should not be.
Running individual tests fails if the tests
exercise code that needs to be initialized by
keystone/common/environment

Change-Id: Ia392d0273fd8a5d12cdf43fb6ff55f1819d8f3f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/95/65195/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unused variables in imagebackend.py

The method create() in /nova/virt/libvirt/ imagebackend.py has two unused
variable: old_format and features.These should be removed.

Change-Id: Id7b8661a162fbdf33de21b29892b5244ef301da7
Closes-Bug: #1266450
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/65197/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add tests for volume_metadata

Add tests and tests for volume_metadata.

Change-Id: I37f96ec6d552eed0f5222505a85b90db0dc326b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/03/62303/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 Huawei Technologies Co.,LTD # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.volume.base import BaseVolumeAdminTest from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.test import attr class VolumeMetadataActionsTest(BaseVolumeAdminTest): _interface = "json" @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(VolumeMetadataActionsTest, cls).setUpClass() # Create a volume vol_name = data_utils.rand_name(cls.__name__ + '-Volume-') resp_vol, cls.volume = \ cls.volumes_client.create_volume(size=1, display_name=vol_name) cls.volume_id = cls.volume['id'] cls.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(cls.volume['id'], 'available') @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): # Delete the test volume cls.volumes_client.delete_volume(cls.volume['id']) cls.volumes_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(cls.volume['id']) super(VolumeMetadataActionsTest, cls).tearDownClass() def tearDown(self): # Update the metadata to {} self.volumes_client.update_all_volume_metadata(self.volume_id, {}) super(VolumeMetadataActionsTest, self).tearDown() @attr(type='gate') def test_create_delete_volume_metadata(self): # Create metadata for the volume metadata = {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3"} rsp, body = self.volumes_client.create_volume_metadata(self.volume_id, metadata) self.assertEqual(200, rsp.status) # Get the metadata of the volume resp, body = self.volumes_client.get_volume_metadata(self.volume_id) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(metadata, body) # Delete one item metadata of the volume rsp, body = self.volumes_client.delete_volume_metadata(self.volume_id, "key1") self.assertEqual(200, rsp.status) resp, body = self.volumes_client.get_volume_metadata(self.volume_id) self.assertNotIn("key1", body) def test_create_volume_metadata_case_sensitive_or_not(self): # Create metadata for the volume metadata = {"key1": "value1", "KEY1": "value1", "KEY2": "value2", "key3": "value3"} resp, c_body = self.volumes_client.create_volume_metadata( self.volume_id, metadata) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) resp, body = self.volumes_client.get_volume_metadata(self.volume_id) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # response body of create must equal with the get, whether case # sensitive or not self.assertEqual(c_body, body) def test_update_all_volume_metadata_case_sensitive_or_not(self): # Update all metadata for the volume metadata = {"key1": "value1", "KEY1": "value1", "KEY2": "value2", "key3": "value3"} resp, c_body = self.volumes_client.update_all_volume_metadata( self.volume_id, metadata) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) resp, body = self.volumes_client.get_volume_metadata(self.volume_id) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # response body of update_all must equal with the get, whether case # sensitive or not self.assertEqual(c_body, body) def test_update_item_volume_metadata(self): # Update item metadata for the volume metadata = {"key1": "value1", "KEY2": "value2", "key3": "value3"} create_expect = {"key1": "value1", "KEY2": "value2", "key3": "value3"} update_item = {"key3": "value3_update"} expect = {"key1": "value1", "KEY2": "value2", "key3": "value3_update"} # Create volume for the volume resp, body = self.volumes_client.create_volume_metadata( self.volume_id, metadata) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(create_expect, body) # Update item metadata resp, body = self.volumes_client.update_item_volume_metadata( self.volume_id, "key3", update_item) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # Get the metadata of the volume resp, body = self.volumes_client.get_volume_metadata(self.volume_id) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(expect, body) class VolumeMetadataActionsTestXML(VolumeMetadataActionsTest): _interface = "xml"

subject: Remove #noqa from most common imports and add them to import_exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-03 16:35:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/954bab7f5e2c3f0f748991bef4cf9e78a9291e98', 'message': "Remove #noqa from most common imports and add them to import_exceptions

We have a lot of import with #noqa that is there to ignore h302,
because it's traditional to import and use a name directly, instead
of a whole module. This hides other errors and gives people the
impression that it's actually fine to import non-modules, you just
have to slap #noqa on those lines.

I went through the code and identified about a dozen names that are
most commonly imported this way. I remove the #noqa tag from them,
and added them to the list in import_exceptions.

I also removed a few unused imports that were revealed in the process.

Change-Id: I27afb8e2b1d4759ec974ded9464d8f010312ee78
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-07 10:30:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/5e1790ecc02e4fe634883276686fa9a7d6f7e34c', 'message': "Remove #noqa from most common imports and add them to import_exceptions

We have a lot of import with #noqa that is there to ignore h302,
because it's traditional to import and use a name directly, instead
of a whole module. This hides other errors and gives people the
impression that it's actually fine to import non-modules, you just
have to slap #noqa on those lines.

I went through the code and identified about a dozen names that are
most commonly imported this way. I remove the #noqa tag from them,
and added them to the list in import_exceptions.

I also removed a few unused imports that were revealed in the process.

Change-Id: I27afb8e2b1d4759ec974ded9464d8f010312ee78

commit_message:
Remove #noqa from most common imports and add them to import_exceptions

We have a lot of import with #noqa that is there to ignore h302,
because it's traditional to import and use a name directly, instead
of a whole module. This hides other errors and gives people the
impression that it's actually fine to import non-modules, you just
have to slap #noqa on those lines.

I went through the code and identified about a dozen names that are
most commonly imported this way. I remove the #noqa tag from them,
and added them to the list in import_exceptions.

I also removed a few unused imports that were revealed in the process.

Change-Id: I27afb8e2b1d4759ec974ded9464d8f010312ee78

commit_message:
Get better format for long lines with PrettyTable

Based on current implement, the cli output format will be bad if
the lines are too long. This issue can be fixed by setting 'max_width'.
However, there is a bug against it, see
https://code.google.com/p/prettytable/source/browse/trunk/CHANGELOG?r=85
line 3. So the requirements.txt is updated as well.

docImpact
Fixes bug 1251283

Change-Id: I0d4192ad9d10a3d6d47a8319463a5edb57719a68

commit_message:
Add DB2 support to nova on redhat platform

Add three new attributes
default["openstack"]["compute"]["platform"]["mysql_python_packages"]
default["openstack"]["compute"]["platform"]["db2_python_packages"]
default["openstack"]["compute"]["platform"]["postgresql_python_packages"]
and add install DB python packages block in nova-common recipe

Change-Id: Ia862c821102119a784c4d8869418253e4ccdb137
Implements: blueprint db2-support

commit_message:
fix NoMethodError on ShellOut calls

================================================================================
Error executing action `run` on resource 'execute[add repository]'
================================================================================

NoMethodError
-------------
undefined method `include?' for #<Mixlib::ShellOut:0x00000002c0b118>

Change-Id: Ib2f562e432373fe319eee1c8485cb112785b0f9b

commit_message:
Add DB2 support to glance on redhat platform

Add a new attribute
default["openstack"]["image"]["platform"]["db2_python_packages"]
and fix an attribute typo in registry recipe

Change-Id: Ic84eefd460d1117c60570394e3b402a09a0e3016
Implements: blueprint db2-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-image refs/changes/41/60141/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it "installs db2 python packages if explicitly told" do chef_run = ::ChefSpec::ChefRunner.new ::REDHAT_OPTS do |n| n.set["openstack"]["db"]["image"]["db_type"] = "db2" end chef_run.converge "openstack-image::registry" [ "db2-odbc", "python-ibm-db", "python-ibm-db-sa" ].each do |pkg| expect(chef_run).to install_package pkg end end

subject: Include 'role[os-image-upload]' to upload images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-17 21:47:06.000000000', 'files': ['roles/os-image.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-repo/commit/76cd43d73a8947ca8e39ddd5fb745ea6407021db', 'message': "Include 'role[os-image-upload]' to upload images

The os-image role is a roll-up role, so if any attributes for uploading images
are included, they'll get uploaded. Also included replacing double-quotes with
single quotes, per rubocop's complaints.

Change-Id: I38b53033dfb56ae8f8e1256cbb6c04208abb0b26
"}]
commit_message:
Include 'role[os-image-upload]' to upload images

The os-image role is a roll-up role, so if any attributes for uploading images
are included, they'll get uploaded. Also included replacing double-quotes with
single quotes, per rubocop's complaints.

Change-Id: I38b53033dfb56ae8f8e1256cbb6c04208abb0b26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-repo refs/changes/65/62765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Remove lingering celery dependencies out of RPM dependencies.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-08 15:03:22.000000000', 'files': ['rpmbuild/SPECS/barbican.spec', 'rpmbuild/package_dependencies.sh', 'debian/control'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/9dc1c1705898d9630f0964446c3ef16f4934971f', 'message': 'Remove lingering celery dependencies out of RPM dependencies.

There were two celery-related dependencies still lurking in the RPM
dependencies file after the move to oslo.messaging. This commit

commit_message:
Remove lingering celery dependencies out of RPM dependencies.

There were two celery-related dependencies still lurking in the RPM
dependencies file after the move to oslo.messaging. This commit
removes the last of those.

Change-Id: I5f2c6851cc1d97f6c6defc408b622907a6fe0322

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Author: Kiall Mac Innes <kiall@hp.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from sqlalchemy import MetaData, Table from migrate.changeset.constraint import UniqueConstraint LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) meta = MetaData() def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta.bind = migrate_engine dialect = migrate_engine.url.get_dialect().name if dialect.startswith('sqlite'): records_table = Table('records', meta, autoload=True) # Add missing unique index constraint = UniqueConstraint('hash', name='unique_recordset', table=records_table) constraint.create() def downgrade(migrate_engine): meta.bind = migrate_engine dialect = migrate_engine.url.get_dialect().name if dialect.startswith('sqlite'): records_table = Table('records', meta, autoload=True) # Drop the unique index constraint = UniqueConstraint('hash', name='unique_recordset', table=records_table) constraint.drop()

commit_message:
Add upgrade-horizon

Upgrade horizon along with the rest of devstack before running new
devstack tests and tempest.

upgrade-horizon is based off of upgrade-keystone.

Change-Id: I6a6e4da06806cb840d7af673673e06f34eb297e0
Related-Bug: #1265057
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/91/64491/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Upgrade Horizon echo_summary "Running upgrade-horizon" $GRENADE_DIR/upgrade-horizon || die $LINENO "Failure in upgrade-horizon" stop $STOP upgrade-horizon 240

commit_message:
Add support for specifying custom domains

Add the ability to pass user_domain_id / user_domain_name, domain_id
/ domain_name, and project_domain_id / project_domain_name to keystone.
These parameters are the first step needed to getting multi-domain
support working via the CLI.

Closes-Bug: #1198171
Change-Id: I81a8534913978ff1cce01ec02741ae477e8c5fa4
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>
Signed-off-by: Bo Tang <btang@cs.utsa.edu>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/89/60989/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: user_domain_id=instance._user_domain_id, user_domain_name=instance._user_domain_name, domain_id=instance._domain_id, domain_name=instance._domain_name,

commit_message:
Map HTTP request codes in jsonschema

Added schema.py to queues/api/v1/jsonschema. This file maps out the HTTP
request codes in jsonschema to be used by the API.

Partially-Implements: cross-transport-api-spec

commit_message:
Allow passing in a handler

A handler is typically used to use alternate
providers of async functionality in kazoo, for
eventlet a specialized handler can be provided,
or the same for gevent; so it's nice to allow
the user to pass that in (the default if not
passed in will be a SequentialThreadingHandler
which as we know in python means threads, and
threads aren't such great performers due to
the GIL).

Change-Id: Iad928c26c6eeda1e735ae8e1b1f8124d0e45404f

commit_message:
WIP: Add APIs for managing TLDs

This change adds APIs for managing TLDs.  Previously TLDs were in
2 files.  With this change, the TLDs will be in the central's storage
database.

Change-Id: Ieec9f180d5f5b1a60628f1ae083c4873a8b1f584

added_lines: @utils.arg('snapshot', metavar='<snapshot>', help='Name or ID of the snapshot to modify.') @utils.arg('--state', metavar='<state>', default='available', help=('Indicate which state to assign the snapshot. ' 'Options include available, error, creating, deleting, ' 'error_deleting. If no state is provided, ' 'available will be used.')) @utils.service_type('share') def do_snapshot_reset_state(cs, args): """Explicitly update the state of a snapshot.""" snapshot = _find_share_snapshot(cs, args.snapshot) snapshot.reset_state(args.state)

commit_message:
Fixed usage of strutils.safe_encode due to py3

safe_encode method from strutils returns different classtype for
py27(str) and py33(bytes) due to different types of string and text.

subject: Add option to swiftclient to download only changed files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-08 13:58:32.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/1415ab05c7253115f1ef2c5fdab24c81203f05e1', 'message': 'Add option to swiftclient to download only changed files

swift has already the upload option "--changed" to upload only changed files.
This patch adds the same feature to the download option. If used the MD5
hexdigest of each file is compared to the etag value and unchanged files are
simply skipped.

Change-Id: I8cdd726c3cad08ecbe17189e673d25ecb64327df
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to swiftclient to download only changed files

swift has already the upload option "--changed" to upload only changed files.
This patch adds the same feature to the download option. If used the MD5
hexdigest of each file is compared to the etag value and unchanged files are
simply skipped.

Change-Id: I8cdd726c3cad08ecbe17189e673d25ecb64327df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/68/65468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [--changed] --changed Only download files that have changed since the last download parser.add_option( '-c', '--changed', action='store_true', dest='changed', default=False, help='Will only download files that have changed since ' 'the last download') if options.changed and out_file != '-': filename = out_file if out_file else path try: fp = open(filename, 'rb') except IOError: pass else: with fp: file_md5 = md5(fp.read()).hexdigest() if file_md5 == etag: thread_manager.print_msg( 'Skipped %s: file not changed', path) return

commit_message:
libvirt: clean in libvirt/*.py

 + The attribute snapshot was not defined (W0201).
 + The private method _text_node should be used as function (R0201).
 + Replaces staticmethod calls by classname instead of instance ref.
 + Removes duplicate code in volume.py for the method: get_hash_str.
 + Fixes a test in libvirt to be more coherent with the static
   method _direct_io_stub.

Change-Id: Ie61350dc0c017feff6b85958c7b3c65da501bfd2

commit_message:
Remove unneeded /var/run/nova/keys from install

At one point /var/run/nova/keys may have been needed but I cannot find
it referenced anywhere else.

This dir won't have any impact on a running system anyway since /var/run
will be a tmpfs mount created a boot.

Change-Id: I550cccb0fb876ef23475014c869789d0a4da6bbe

commit_message:
Change internal data store of LogBook from list to dict

This way it is consistent with FlowDetail, and offers much faster
*Find()*. Comments are also updated.

Change-Id: I014abc1beff317200586b23da90dfc24f4c7875a

added_lines: """This class that contains a dict of flow detail entries for a given *job* so that the job can track what 'work' has been completed for resumption/reverting and miscellaneous tracking purposes. The data contained within this class need *not* be backed by the backend self._flowdetails_by_id = {} def add(self, fd): self._flowdetails_by_id[fd.uuid] = fd return self._flowdetails_by_id.get(flow_uuid, None) for fd in six.itervalues(self._flowdetails_by_id): return len(self._flowdetails_by_id) """This class contains a dict of task detail entries for a given flow along with any metadata associated with that flow. The data contained within this class need *not* be backed by the backend
deleted_lines: """This class that contains an append-only list of flow detail entries for a given *job* so that the job can track what 'work' has been completed for resumption/reverting and miscellaneous tracking purposes. The data contained within this class need *not* backed by the backend self._flowdetails = [] def add(self, flow_detail): self._flowdetails.append(flow_detail) for fd in self._flowdetails: if fd.uuid == flow_uuid: return fd return None for fd in self._flowdetails: return len(self._flowdetails) """This class contains an append-only list of task detail entries for a given flow along with any metadata associated with that flow. The data contained within this class need *not* backed by the backend

commit_message:
Fixing misspelled encryption key in QemuImgInfo

This modification addresses Bug #1257829, specifically addresing
the use of a misspelled 'encryption' key to retrieve image encryption
information returned by calls to the 'qemu-img' command. Updates made
to oslo-incubator in the following patch are included, along with test
cases:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61877/

Change-Id: I6df2dc6b1569c1c1f2d2db1e92c650ef13c15274
Closes-Bug: #1257829
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/71/62071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
self.assertEqual(inf.encrypted, None) self.assertEqual(inf.encrypted, None) def test_qemu_img_info_encrypted(self): TEST_PATH = "img/qemu.qcow2" TEST_RETURN = "image: qemu.qcow2
"\ "backing_file: qemu.qcow2 (actual path: qemu.qcow2)
"\ "file_format: qcow2
"\ "virtual_size: 50M (52428800 bytes)
"\ "cluster_size: 65536
"\ "disk_size: 196K (200704 bytes)
"\ "encrypted: yes" TEST_STR = "image: qemu.qcow2
"\ "file_format: qcow2
"\ "virtual_size: 52428800
"\ "disk_size: 200704
"\ "cluster_size: 65536
"\ "backing_file: qemu.qcow2
"\ "encrypted: yes" mox = self._mox mox.StubOutWithMock(utils, 'execute') utils.execute( 'env', 'LC_ALL=C', 'LANG=C', 'qemu-img', 'info', TEST_PATH, run_as_root=True).AndReturn( (TEST_RETURN, 'ignored') ) mox.ReplayAll() inf = image_utils.qemu_img_info(TEST_PATH) self.assertEqual(inf.image, 'qemu.qcow2') self.assertEqual(inf.backing_file, 'qemu.qcow2') self.assertEqual(inf.file_format, 'qcow2') self.assertEqual(inf.virtual_size, 52428800) self.assertEqual(inf.cluster_size, 65536) self.assertEqual(inf.disk_size, 200704) self.assertEqual(inf.encrypted, 'yes') self.assertEqual(str(inf), TEST_STR)

commit_message:
Adds new options on libvirt drivers

 * console; choice of the console for message output.
 * max_console_bytes; the maximum number of bytes
   retrieved from the console

Note: In relation with the bug #1259323
      but does not correct it.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ibac2b48908f48e42d827968d38fe28cb6df0dd51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/61830/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('console', default='console=tty0 console=ttyS0', help='Location to retrieve all guest console messages', deprecated_group='DEFAULT'), cfg.IntOpt('max_console_bytes', default=100, help='The maximun bytes retrieved from the console. ' '(in kbytes).', deprecated_group='DEFAULT'),MAX_CONSOLE_BYTES = CONF.libvirt.max_console_bytes * unit.Ki CONSOLE = CONF.libvirt.console

commit_message:
Make sure the linuxbridge agent can be restarted

Add notifier to restart linuxbridge-agent when linuxbridge plugin
configuration file is updated.

Closes-bug: #1254981

Change-Id: I67e071d35c77f6ec36c8f2fd2bea34616801a486

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone

Using assertEqual/assertNotEqual to test if an element
is or is not None is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone
which were created for these types of tests.

Change-Id: I969ee943e31b4fa0291f6cb9e21e2f654e88e66e

subject: Update spec_helper to include 'chefspec/berkshelf'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-08 10:54:02.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common/commit/3f45e80ae86bb79ce58c3908fa148417eddbcfc6', 'message': "Update spec_helper to include 'chefspec/berkshelf'

This minor change allows you to run rspec outside of strainer while
still having cookbook dependencies automatically handled by berkshelf
(which also means you can run individual chefspec tests).

Note that this change does marginally increase the time it takes to run

A similar change was recently accepted in the openstack-compute

Change-Id: Ia5b5f3cc8aab853dd0e8c3b120ed178b0f0887db
"}]
commit_message:
Update spec_helper to include 'chefspec/berkshelf'

This minor change allows you to run rspec outside of strainer while
still having cookbook dependencies automatically handled by berkshelf
(which also means you can run individual chefspec tests).

Note that this change does marginally increase the time it takes to run
a strainer test.

A similar change was recently accepted in the openstack-compute
cookbook.

Change-Id: Ia5b5f3cc8aab853dd0e8c3b120ed178b0f0887db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/54/65454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require "chefspec/berkshelf"

commit_message:
Reuse common functional from cliutils

Module novaclient.utils has the same methods like in cliutils
from Oslo. In the process of unification of the clients code
we should reuse common functionality from Oslo.

 + Removes methods: arg, env, add_arg, unauthenticated,
   isunauthenticated
 + Using new methods from cliutils: arg, env, add_arg, isunauthenticated
 + Correctly indenting the code

Related to blueprint common-client-library-2
Change-Id: Iade2f2b1af14c14c737b4188883e0170a36b0578
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/99/65299/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use Resource class from Oslo

All methods of Resource class from keystoneclient are similar to methods
from common code.
In the process of unification of the clients code we should
reuse common functionality from Oslo.

Change-Id: I9ec90817ed3baabc08e3846b0814f3b38b1d0135
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/48/65448/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneclient.openstack.common.apiclient import base as common_baseResource = common_base.Resource
deleted_lines: class Resource(object): """Base class for OpenStack resources (tenant, user, etc.). This is pretty much just a bag for attributes. """ HUMAN_ID = False NAME_ATTR = 'name' def __init__(self, manager, info, loaded=False): """Populate and bind to a manager. :param manager: Manager object :param info: dictionary representing resource attributes :param loaded: prevent lazy-loading if set to True """ self.manager = manager self._info = {} self._add_details(info) self._loaded = loaded @property def human_id(self): """Human-readable ID which can be used for bash completion. """ if self.NAME_ATTR in self.__dict__ and self.HUMAN_ID: return strutils.to_slug(getattr(self, self.NAME_ATTR)) return None def _add_details(self, info): for (k, v) in six.iteritems(info): setattr(self, k, v) self._info[k] = v def __getattr__(self, k): if k not in self.__dict__: #NOTE(bcwaldon): disallow lazy-loading if already loaded once if not self.is_loaded(): self.get() return self.__getattr__(k) raise AttributeError(k) else: return self.__dict__[k] def __repr__(self): reprkeys = sorted(k for k in self.__dict__ if k[0] != '_' and k != 'manager') info = ", ".join("%s=%s" % (k, getattr(self, k)) for k in reprkeys) return "<%s %s>" % (self.__class__.__name__, info) def get(self): # set_loaded() first ... so if we have to bail, we know we tried. self.set_loaded(True) if not hasattr(self.manager, 'get'): return new = self.manager.get(self.id) if new: self._add_details(new._info) def delete(self): return self.manager.delete(self) def __eq__(self, other): if not isinstance(other, Resource): return NotImplemented # two resources of different types are not equal if not isinstance(other, self.__class__): return False if hasattr(self, 'id') and hasattr(other, 'id'): return self.id == other.id return self._info == other._info def is_loaded(self): return self._loaded def set_loaded(self, val): self._loaded = val

commit_message:
Verify response jsonschema for List Messages by ID

This patch verifies that the API response for List Messages by ID
matches the expected jsonschema.

Change-Id: Icd6fcab5d36ce79b8030017eff73815832fedf59
Tests-Bug: #1240897
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/58/60858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonschema def assertSchema(self, response, expectedSchema): """Compares the json response with the expected schema :param response: response json returned by the API. :param expectedSchema: expected schema definition for response. """ try: schema_validation = jsonschema.validate(response, expectedSchema) except jsonschema.ValidationError as message: assert False, message

missing user-defined /{protocol_id} in PUT call

Also corrected the response code for the "add protocol" call, which
should be 201 as it's a create operation.

commit_message:
Removes unnecessary api-paste.ini configuration

Paremeter api_paste_config defaults to '/etc/nova/api-paste.ini',
so it is not needed to set it in nova.conf. Without having
the parameter in nova.conf we can use this module together
with dist.conf. Also filter:authtoken parameters should be
in nova.conf and not in api-paste.ini. Removes filter:authtoken
configuration from api-paste.ini in case it is filled there.

Change-Id: Ice3883bc72fe303cbaf32a3fc46fb9da302b1a3b
(cherry picked from commit ee469886921b7168a0ae974f7557d355af98aacb)

commit_message:
Introduce keystone_url parameter

This parameter deprecates keystone_host, keystone_port & keystone_scheme
and allows to pass a complete url.

Implements blueprint serve-keystone-from-wsgi

Change-Id: Ia8aa6e6377abf0e84427174fb946f4efa5defa12
(cherry picked from commit 314df2136eb54ac95d0716d00f20265c5c439494)

commit_message:
horizon replaced nodejs by a python alternative

since commit a0739c9423a4c559b45af96fa4cdb30539dcdbd7 and the Havana
release, horizon uses a pure Python alternative to nodejs.

Horizon changed the way to use the compress utility, the option
offline_compress is no longer available.
Thanks to Maxime Vidori for the information.

Change-Id: Ie290701b00c97352838e13182b940a6de46a591f
(cherry picked from commit fae0d04b82867dab3c355e5f1d5a9b2d0054f949)

commit_message:
Bugfix: Fix fragment name for Quota middleware

  Bugfix for commit 4157cb9 (uniformisation of pipeline names)
  According other swift proxy middlewares, the concat fragments
    doesn't contains  proxy  (concat frag. are generated by pipeline)
    see l195 and l196 of tests/site.pp

Change-Id: I99f9e5f5282b3e8db89fd56109ec8074ea1fa8f5
(cherry picked from commit c1aee547bc8393b75fabecb930b5dbee6b4111f4)

subject: Fix filter name for puppetdb
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-07 16:47:02.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/swift_storage_server_spec.rb', 'manifests/storage/server.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/19baf012b4ab08ef66fc37687f55f6caaa01644a', 'message': 'Fix filter name for puppetdb

When creating the filter class name the last part is not capitalized.
So Swift::Storage::Filter::Healthcheck[bla] is named
Swift::Storage::Filter::healthcheck[bla].  Puppet don't detect the
syntax error as the resource is "created" within a string.  But
puppetdb's parser do not let this work.

This fix it and adjust the tests.

Change-Id: If11c3ad0e98d14b9387b3daa4afeb118387100f8
Closes-Bug: #1252998
(cherry picked from commit 3566f9fa651d8e50a81a3bcb042beb126da46f3d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix filter name for puppetdb

When creating the filter class name the last part is not capitalized.
So Swift::Storage::Filter::Healthcheck[bla] is named
Swift::Storage::Filter::healthcheck[bla].  Puppet don't detect the
syntax error as the resource is "created" within a string.  But
puppetdb's parser do not let this work.

This fix it and adjust the tests.

Change-Id: If11c3ad0e98d14b9387b3daa4afeb118387100f8
Closes-Bug: #1252998
(cherry picked from commit 3566f9fa651d8e50a81a3bcb042beb126da46f3d)

commit_message:
Add resume_guests_state_on_host_boot support

resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is a nova-compute flag which allow to
enable or not the boot of  guests that were running before the host
reboot.

Change-Id: I980cb9a274072889cb545ecd6d27fc58a43481ab

commit_message:
Allow user creating with fields have ":" or "-"

If we difine custom fields which ":" or "-", when creating user,keystone
will convert ":" and "-" to "_". It should not be so.

Change-Id: I9d09dd101eb1df88ca0bc7487c810eb55b836b89
Closes-bug: #1241218

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone

Using assertEqual/assertNotEqual to test if an element
is or is not None is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone
which were created for these types of tests.

Change-Id: Ieba2d4ce5602885dc8a33a938a40f3086879b2c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/00/51100/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
1st & last sample timestamps in Resource representation

Fixes bug 1262335

Previously, the first and last sample timestamps associated
with a resource were calculated by the storage driver, but
then discarded.

Now, we include these values in the API resource representation.

Change-Id: I3cf6081e1ac1294083f6326f85dabebab0d02203

deleted_lines: timestamp = datetime.datetime "UTC date and time of the last update to any meter for the resource"

commit_message:
Wait for the server before validate the rotation result

This commit is for test:
tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions:\
ServerActionsTestJSON.test_create_backup
In most cases, the nova service sends the response of
the request that queries the backups before the rotation
function completes its work, and then 3 backups will be
and the test will fail.
This commit makes the use case wait for the server to
become active before sends the query request to ensure
rotation task has completed before the verification.

Closes-Bug: #1257614

Change-Id: Ic6443e3835fdb9d53f5ab643a04312c59ecb4c58

commit_message:
Fix downgrade in 002_quota_class.py for MySQL

Downgrade in the script 002_quota_class.py is failing for MySQL
because there is an attempt to delete the quota_classes table
while the reservations table still has a foreign key defined.
The foreign key causes the delete of the quota_classes table to fail.

This change is based upon commit 8328fc46d783f4ec9286eededafa91afae89cba0
which makes a similar change to 018_add_qos_specs.py .

Change-Id: I81844a2da4fb3b831f1f9dead3634e82f54e559e
Closes-bug: 1265944
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/31/65131/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if migrate_engine.name == 'mysql': # NOTE(jsbryant): MySQL Cannot drop the quota_usages table # until the foreign key reservations_ibfk_1 is removed. We # remove the foreign key first, and then we drop the table. table = Table('reservations', meta, autoload=True) ref_table = Table('reservations', meta, autoload=True) params = {'columns': [table.c['usage_id']], 'refcolumns': [ref_table.c['id']], 'name': 'reservations_ibfk_1'} try: fkey = ForeignKeyConstraint(**params) fkey.drop() except Exception as e: LOG.error(_("Dropping foreign key reservations_ibfk_1 failed."))

commit_message:
Removed deprecated config option hp3par_domain

The hp3par_domain config option was deprecated in the Havana release.
This just removes it from the code, test and config sample file
for the Icehouse release.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib3820cfc1b0db8a8b5755ac59d30691ce832fcea

commit_message:
Added unit tests for module neutron/plugins/nicira/api_client/client.py

blueprint unittest-for-nicira-api-client-client
Change-Id: I9b4cd13353930c5210b78dd354a050a057139b7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/59948/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack Foundation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import eventlet import httplib import mock import time from neutron.plugins.nicira.api_client import client from neutron.plugins.nicira.api_client.client_eventlet import \ NvpApiClientEventlet from neutron.tests import base class TestNvpApiClient(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestNvpApiClient, self).setUp() self.timeout = client.DEFAULT_CONNECT_TIMEOUT self.host = 'localhost' self.port = 9999 self.data = (self.host, self.port, False) self.sec_data = (self.host, self.port, True) self.semaphore = eventlet.semaphore.Semaphore() self.t_sem_data = (self.semaphore, self.port, True) self.f_sem_data = (self.semaphore, self.port, False) self.testNvpApiClient = NvpApiClientEventlet([self.sec_data], 'user', 'password') self.connection = self.testNvpApiClient._create_connection(*self.data) self.s_conn = self.testNvpApiClient._create_connection(*self.sec_data) def tearDown(self): super(TestNvpApiClient, self).tearDown() del self.testNvpApiClient def test_create_connection(self): self.assertEqual(self.connection.host, self.host) self.assertEqual(self.connection.port, self.port) self.assertEqual(self.connection.timeout, self.timeout) self.assertIsInstance(self.connection, httplib.HTTPConnection) def test_create_secure_connection(self): secure_conn = self.testNvpApiClient._create_connection(*self.sec_data) self.assertEqual(secure_conn.host, self.host) self.assertEqual(secure_conn.port, self.port) self.assertEqual(secure_conn.timeout, self.timeout) self.assertIsInstance(secure_conn, httplib.HTTPSConnection) def test_conn_params(self): self.assertEqual(self.data, self.testNvpApiClient._conn_params(self.connection)) def test_user(self): self.assertEqual(self.testNvpApiClient.user, 'user') def test_password(self): self.assertEqual(self.testNvpApiClient.password, 'password') def test_nvp_config_gen(self): self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_config_gen = 666 self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_gen_timeout = -1 self.assertEqual(666, self.testNvpApiClient.nvp_config_gen) def test_nvp_config_gen_ts_is_not_none(self): self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_gen_timeout = 13 self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_config_gen_ts = 5 self.assertEqual(None, self.testNvpApiClient.nvp_config_gen) def test_nvp_config_gen_ts_is_none(self): self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_config_gen = 4545 self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_gen_timeout = time.time() self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_config_gen_ts = None self.assertEqual(4545, self.testNvpApiClient.nvp_config_gen) def test_nvp_config_gen_third_else(self): self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_config_gen = 45 self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_gen_timeout = time.time() self.testNvpApiClient._nvp_config_gen_ts = time.time() self.assertEqual(45, self.testNvpApiClient.nvp_config_gen) def test_auth_cookie(self): self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.connection, self.data) self.assertEqual(self.port, self.testNvpApiClient.auth_cookie(self.connection)) @mock.patch.object(client.NvpApiClient, '_get_provider_data') def test_auth_cookie_null_data(self, mock_get_provider_data): mock_get_provider_data.return_value = None self.assertIsNone(self.testNvpApiClient.auth_cookie(self.connection)) mock_get_provider_data.assert_called_with(self.connection) def test_set_auth_cookie(self): self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.connection, self.data) self.testNvpApiClient.set_auth_cookie(self.connection, self.port) self.assertEqual((self.host, self.port), self.testNvpApiClient._api_provider_data[self.data]) @mock.patch.object(client.NvpApiClient, '_get_provider_data') def test_set_auth_cookie_null_data(self, mock_get_provider_data): mock_get_provider_data.return_value = {} self.testNvpApiClient._api_provider_data = {} self.testNvpApiClient.set_auth_cookie(self.connection, self.port) self.assertEqual({}, self.testNvpApiClient._api_provider_data) mock_get_provider_data.assert_called_with(self.connection) def test_acquire_connection(self): result = self.testNvpApiClient.acquire_connection(auto_login=False) self.assertIsInstance(result, httplib.HTTPConnection) def test_acquire_connection_none_api_providers(self): self.testNvpApiClient._api_providers = None self.assertIsNone( self.testNvpApiClient.acquire_connection(auto_login=True)) @mock.patch.object(client.NvpApiClient, '_create_connection') def test_acquire_connection_new_conn(self, mock_create_connection): self.testNvpApiClient.CONN_IDLE_TIMEOUT = -time.time() mock_create_connection.return_value = self.connection priority, conn = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.get() conn.last_used = time.time() self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.put((priority, conn)) result = self.testNvpApiClient.acquire_connection(auto_login=False) self.assertIsInstance(result, httplib.HTTPConnection) self.assertTrue(mock_create_connection.called) @mock.patch.object(client.NvpApiClient, '_wait_for_login') def test_acquire_connection_do_not_wait_for_login(self, mock_wait_for_login): mock_wait_for_login.return_value = True result = self.testNvpApiClient.acquire_connection(auto_login=True) self.assertIsInstance(result, httplib.HTTPConnection) self.assertTrue(mock_wait_for_login.called) def test_release_connection_params_not_in_api_providers(self): origin_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.assertIsNone(self.testNvpApiClient.release_connection( self.connection)) new_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.assertEqual(origin_size, new_size) def test_release_connection(self): self.s_conn.priority = 1313 self.testNvpApiClient.release_connection(self.s_conn) self.assertIn((self.s_conn.priority, self.s_conn), self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.queue) def test_release_connection_bad_state(self): origin_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.testNvpApiClient.release_connection(self.s_conn, bad_state=True) new_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.assertEqual(origin_size + 1, new_size) def test_release_connection_no_release(self): self.s_conn.no_release = True origin_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.testNvpApiClient.release_connection(self.s_conn) new_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.assertEqual(origin_size, new_size) def test_release_connection_service_unavail(self): origin_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.testNvpApiClient.release_connection(self.s_conn, service_unavail=True) new_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.assertEqual(origin_size + 1, new_size) @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, "_get_provider_data") @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, "_login") def test_wait_for_login(self, mock_login, mock_get_provider_data): mock_login.return_value = self.f_sem_data mock_get_provider_data.return_value = self.f_sem_data self.testNvpApiClient._wait_for_login(self.connection) self.assertEqual((self.semaphore, self.f_sem_data), self.testNvpApiClient._api_provider_data[self.data]) mock_get_provider_data.assert_called_with(self.connection) mock_login.assert_called_with(self.connection, None) @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, "_get_provider_data") def test_wait_for_login_data_is_none(self, mock_get_provider_data): mock_get_provider_data.return_value = None self.assertIsNone( self.testNvpApiClient._wait_for_login(self.connection)) mock_get_provider_data.assert_called_with(self.connection) @mock.patch.object(eventlet.semaphore.Semaphore, 'acquire') @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, "_get_provider_data") @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, "_login") def test_wait_for_login_false_blocking(self, mock_login, mock_get_provider_data, mock_acquire): mock_acquire.return_value = False mock_login.return_value = self.t_sem_data mock_get_provider_data.return_value = self.t_sem_data self.assertIsNone( self.testNvpApiClient._wait_for_login(self.connection)) mock_get_provider_data.assert_called_with(self.connection) mock_acquire.assert_any_call(blocking=False) mock_acquire.assert_any_call(blocking=True) self.assertFalse(mock_login.called) def test_get_provider_data(self): self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.connection, self.data) self.assertEqual( self.data, self.testNvpApiClient._get_provider_data(self.connection)) def test_set_provider_data(self): self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.connection, self.data) self.assertEqual(self.data, self.testNvpApiClient._api_provider_data[self.data]) def test_set_provider_data_is_none(self): self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.connection, self.data) old_len = self.testNvpApiClient._api_provider_data.__len__() self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.connection, data=None) new_len = self.testNvpApiClient._api_provider_data.__len__() self.assertEqual((old_len - 1), new_len) def test_normalize_conn_params(self): self.assertEqual( self.data, self.testNvpApiClient._normalize_conn_params(self.connection)) def test_normalize_conn_params_not_tuple_ahd_http_connection(self): self.assertEqual(self.host, self.testNvpApiClient._normalize_conn_params( self.host)) def test_normalize_conn_params_port_is_none_and_not_ssl(self): test_data = (self.host, None, False) self.assertEqual((self.host, 80, False), self.testNvpApiClient._normalize_conn_params( test_data)) def test_normalize_conn_params_port_is_none_and_ssl(self): test_data = (self.host, None, True) self.assertEqual((self.host, 443, True), self.testNvpApiClient._normalize_conn_params( test_data))

commit_message:
Reuse common functional from Oslo cliutils

Use common utils from Oslo instead of trove utils.
In the process of unification of the clients code
we should reuse common functionality from Oslo.

bp common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I1d2384fc4166f30026005a31fae0279e1eb0f68e

commit_message:
WIP: CLI code based on python-openstackclient

Added code for 'assembly show' command

For CLI processing we intend to use python-openstackclient.
Since Solum is not yet OS project, we cannot add solum specific
processing in the main python-openstackclient repository.
So we have decided to keep a local copy of it here.
We provide a script which can be used to sync the local copy
with the main repo.

blueprint solum-minimal-cli

Change-Id: I2470bedc5c8e8a54b851c450ecce140fc25fde2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-solumclient refs/changes/71/63971/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import copy import mock from openstackclient.common import exceptions from openstackclient.identity.v2_0 import role from openstackclient.tests import fakes from openstackclient.tests.identity.v2_0 import fakes as identity_fakes class TestRole(identity_fakes.TestIdentityv2): def setUp(self): super(TestRole, self).setUp() # Get a shortcut to the TenantManager Mock self.projects_mock = self.app.client_manager.identity.tenants self.projects_mock.reset_mock() # Get a shortcut to the UserManager Mock self.users_mock = self.app.client_manager.identity.users self.users_mock.reset_mock() # Get a shortcut to the RoleManager Mock self.roles_mock = self.app.client_manager.identity.roles self.roles_mock.reset_mock() class TestRoleAdd(TestRole): def setUp(self): super(TestRoleAdd, self).setUp() self.projects_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.PROJECT), loaded=True, ) self.users_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.USER), loaded=True, ) self.roles_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ) self.roles_mock.add_user_role.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ) # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role.AddRole(self.app, None) def test_role_add(self): arglist = [ '--project', identity_fakes.project_name, '--user', identity_fakes.user_name, identity_fakes.role_name, ] verifylist = [ ('project', identity_fakes.project_name), ('user', identity_fakes.user_name), ('role', identity_fakes.role_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) # RoleManager.add_user_role(user, role, tenant=None) self.roles_mock.add_user_role.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.project_id, ) collist = ('id', 'name') self.assertEqual(columns, collist) datalist = ( identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.role_name, ) self.assertEqual(data, datalist) class TestRoleCreate(TestRole): def setUp(self): super(TestRoleCreate, self).setUp() self.roles_mock.create.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ) # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role.CreateRole(self.app, None) def test_role_create_no_options(self): arglist = [ identity_fakes.role_name, ] verifylist = [ ('role_name', identity_fakes.role_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) # RoleManager.create(name) self.roles_mock.create.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.role_name, ) collist = ('id', 'name') self.assertEqual(columns, collist) datalist = ( identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.role_name, ) self.assertEqual(data, datalist) class TestRoleDelete(TestRole): def setUp(self): super(TestRoleDelete, self).setUp() self.roles_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ) self.roles_mock.delete.return_value = None # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role.DeleteRole(self.app, None) def test_role_delete_no_options(self): arglist = [ identity_fakes.role_name, ] verifylist = [ ('role', identity_fakes.role_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.roles_mock.delete.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.role_id, ) class TestRoleList(TestRole): def setUp(self): super(TestRoleList, self).setUp() self.roles_mock.list.return_value = [ fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ), ] # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role.ListRole(self.app, None) def test_role_list_no_options(self): arglist = [] verifylist = [] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.roles_mock.list.assert_called_with() collist = ('ID', 'Name') self.assertEqual(columns, collist) datalist = (( identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.role_name, ), ) self.assertEqual(tuple(data), datalist) class TestUserRoleList(TestRole): def setUp(self): super(TestUserRoleList, self).setUp() self.projects_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.PROJECT), loaded=True, ) self.users_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.USER), loaded=True, ) self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.return_value = [ fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ), ] # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role.ListUserRole(self.app, None) def test_user_role_list_no_options(self): arglist = [] verifylist = [] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # This argument combination should raise a CommandError self.assertRaises( exceptions.CommandError, self.cmd.take_action, parsed_args, ) def test_user_role_list_no_options_def_creds(self): auth_ref = self.app.client_manager.auth_ref = mock.MagicMock() auth_ref.project_id.return_value = identity_fakes.project_id auth_ref.user_id.return_value = identity_fakes.user_id arglist = [] verifylist = [] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.project_id, ) collist = ('ID', 'Name', 'Project', 'User') self.assertEqual(columns, collist) datalist = (( identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.role_name, identity_fakes.project_name, identity_fakes.user_name, ), ) self.assertEqual(tuple(data), datalist) def test_user_role_list_project(self): self.projects_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.PROJECT_2), loaded=True, ) arglist = [ '--project', identity_fakes.PROJECT_2['name'], ] verifylist = [ ('project', identity_fakes.PROJECT_2['name']), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # This argument combination should raise a CommandError self.assertRaises( exceptions.CommandError, self.cmd.take_action, parsed_args, ) def test_user_role_list_project_def_creds(self): auth_ref = self.app.client_manager.auth_ref = mock.MagicMock() auth_ref.project_id.return_value = identity_fakes.project_id auth_ref.user_id.return_value = identity_fakes.user_id self.projects_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.PROJECT_2), loaded=True, ) arglist = [ '--project', identity_fakes.PROJECT_2['name'], ] verifylist = [ ('project', identity_fakes.PROJECT_2['name']), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.PROJECT_2['id'], ) collist = ('ID', 'Name', 'Project', 'User') self.assertEqual(columns, collist) datalist = (( identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.role_name, identity_fakes.PROJECT_2['name'], identity_fakes.user_name, ), ) self.assertEqual(tuple(data), datalist) class TestRoleRemove(TestRole): def setUp(self): super(TestRoleRemove, self).setUp() self.projects_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.PROJECT), loaded=True, ) self.users_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.USER), loaded=True, ) self.roles_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ) self.roles_mock.remove_user_role.return_value = None # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role.RemoveRole(self.app, None) def test_role_remove(self): arglist = [ '--project', identity_fakes.project_name, '--user', identity_fakes.user_name, identity_fakes.role_name, ] verifylist = [ ('role', identity_fakes.role_name), ('project', identity_fakes.project_name), ('user', identity_fakes.user_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) # RoleManager.remove_user_role(user, role, tenant=None) self.roles_mock.remove_user_role.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.project_id, ) class TestRoleShow(TestRole): def setUp(self): super(TestRoleShow, self).setUp() self.roles_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ) # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role.ShowRole(self.app, None) def test_service_show(self): arglist = [ identity_fakes.role_name, ] verifylist = [ ('role', identity_fakes.role_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) # RoleManager.get(role) self.roles_mock.get.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.role_name, ) collist = ('id', 'name') self.assertEqual(columns, collist) datalist = ( identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.role_name, ) self.assertEqual(data, datalist)

commit_message:
Adjust import order according to PEP8 imports rule

This patch just adjust import order to follow PEP8 imports rule.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#imports

Imports should be grouped in the following order:
1) Standard library imports
2) Related third party imports
3) Local application/library specific imports

Change-Id: Ib67dcbcf8f2ea02d8bb828602eeb0466330e8039

commit_message:
Log two Exceptions seperately when get images information

When get images information, two exceptions(NotFound and
Forbidden) not logged, I add log to the two exceptions.

Closes-Bug:#1263871
Change-Id: I7fadfb6b35b911abb80583ac1926a1ba50429de2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/91/63891/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.NotFound: msg = _("Invalid marker. Image could not be found") LOG.info(msg) raise exc.HTTPNotFound() except exception.Forbidden: # If it's private and doesn't belong to them, don't let on # that it exists msg = _("Access denied to marker image but returning 'not found'") LOG.info(msg) raise exc.HTTPNotFound()
deleted_lines: except (exception.NotFound, exception.Forbidden) as e: msg = _("Invalid marker. Image could not be found.") raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg)

commit_message:
Sync config generator from oslo-incubator

Sync from oslo-incubator with the following patches about the config
generator:

7c18261 Temporary workaround for config generator
4b3e32b Sort the output of config/generator.py by group name
806272e Improve error reporting on import failures
6cd1c33 Clean up extra modules code
3d077a3 Print the deprecated group/name for each option
aec6d94 config.generator: allow extra modules importing
ddc4f0d Fix error when no custom config file matches *.conf.sample
d4bf84d Allow generate_sample MODULEPATH to be set in env

UpgradeImpact

DocImpact, the default values in keystone_authtoken config group are
changed.

Change-Id: If7181e14db2e43e42255bb6221d0543c13c4e5a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/62815/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EXTRA_MODULES_FILE="`dirname $0`/oslo.config.generator.rc" if test -r "$EXTRA_MODULES_FILE" then source "$EXTRA_MODULES_FILE" fi DEFAULT_MODULEPATH=nova.openstack.common.config.generator MODULEPATH=${MODULEPATH:-$DEFAULT_MODULEPATH}# Hook to allow projects to append custom config file snippets CONCAT_FILES=$(ls $BASEDIR/tools/config/*.conf.sample 2>/dev/null) for CONCAT_FILE in $CONCAT_FILES; do
deleted_lines: MODULEPATH=nova.openstack.common.config.generator# Hook to allow projects to specify custom config file snippets for CONCAT_FILE in $BASEDIR/tools/config/*.conf.sample; do

subject: Avoid false negatives on message signature comparison
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-03 17:11:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/9cb773f03d54b52c49d5aee4e4961f4023062384', 'message': "Avoid false negatives on message signature comparison

Fixes bug 1262255

Previously, samples for the 'instance.scheduled' meter were always
rejected with a false negative on the message signature verification.

The problem occured because certain resource metadata (such as the
block_device_mapping) in the 'scheduler.run_instance.scheduled'
notification are realized as a list of dict, and are thus similarly
encoded in the corresponding sample payload.

However the message signature computation then became indeterminate,
as the unicode representation of equivalent dicts is not guaranteed
equal (e.g. depends on insertion order in the case of hash collisions).

Now, we avoid false negatives by explicitly re-ordering insertion
into such dicts.

Change-Id: I77f7d89229518cf040608d7eb3307e2257bce07a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-06 09:35:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/47342b57e93de20ad468e8730bc6ad427bb936b9', 'message': "Avoid false negatives on message signature comparison

commit_message:
Avoid false negatives on message signature comparison

Fixes bug 1262255

Previously, samples for the 'instance.scheduled' meter were always
rejected with a false negative on the message signature verification.

The problem occured because certain resource metadata (such as the
block_device_mapping) in the 'scheduler.run_instance.scheduled'
notification are realized as a list of dict, and are thus similarly
encoded in the corresponding sample payload.

However the message signature computation then became indeterminate,
as the unicode representation of equivalent dicts is not guaranteed
equal (e.g. depends on insertion order in the case of hash collisions).

Now, we avoid false negatives by explicitly re-ordering insertion
into such dicts.

Change-Id: I77f7d89229518cf040608d7eb3307e2257bce07a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/63/64863/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _item(x): # in the special case of the list item itself being a dict, # create an equivalent dict with a predictable insertion order # to avoid inconsistencies in the message signature computation # for equivalent payloads modulo ordering return (dict(sorted(x.items(), key=lambda i: i[0])) if isinstance(x, dict) else x) yield name, list(map(lambda x: unicode(_item(x)).encode('utf-8'),

commit_message:
Testing devstack gate

After merging [1] devstack gate started failing. There is already a
thread [2] related to this in mailing list. Test whether the gate is
happy if we remove oslo.sphinx from test-requirements.txt.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/64226
[2] http://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg12440.html

Change-Id: Ic0759d8885aff002c07d7cbb2c9ab80b51da03f4

commit_message:
Add namespace cleanup options

Adds a configuration option to tell the network agents to delete
namespaces when they are no longer in use. The option defaults to
False so that the agent will not attempt to delete namespaces in
environments where this is not safe.

It affects only L3 & DHCP agents for now.

Change-Id: Ie9e27ae55b796ec12601dbfbeda45184188864f5
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/49/63949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set up API page to generate comprehensive PDF of methods

Update formatting as necessary.
Create book files for each API service.
Chunk information so it's reusable.
Clean up WADLs as necessary.

Change-Id: Iea3d3a69be8d0904427c480cc6930ba2b5d2f029
Partial-Bug: #1258208

subject: Whitelist external netaddr requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-06 03:34:17.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c3411d9ef1a0eaa1c18d19c6a8465d87fec62ca6', 'message': "Whitelist external netaddr requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netaddr package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I005e752c8cb9bca78b1ebe777eb5230e9bf05bd8
"}]
commit_message:
Whitelist external netaddr requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netaddr package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I005e752c8cb9bca78b1ebe777eb5230e9bf05bd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/65021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install --allow-external netaddr --allow-insecure netaddr -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Whitelist external netaddr requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netaddr package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I005e752c8cb9bca78b1ebe777eb5230e9bf05bd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/65020/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install --allow-external netaddr --allow-insecure netaddr -U {opts} {packages}

subject: Filter out deleted images from storage usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-18 14:29:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/e44f56a21fba2b3efa236d9e54c8e81528cc523c', 'message': "Filter out deleted images from storage usage

All database API's currently include deleted images in the calc of
storage usage. This is not an issue when deleted images don't have
locations. However, there are cases where a deleted image has deleted
locations as well and that causes the current algorithm to count those
locations as if they were allocating space.

Besides this bug, it makes sense to not load deleted images from the
database if we're actually not considering them as valid images.

Change-Id: I82f08a8f522c81541e4f77597c2ba0aeb68556ce
Closes-Bug: #1261738
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-18 14:53:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/99ea51bf8d2acf7ddafc9b31c727d495e9d1d8d3', 'message': "Filter out deleted images from storage usage

All database API's currently include deleted images in the calc of
storage usage. This is not an issue when deleted images don't have
locations. However, there are cases where a deleted image has deleted
locations as well and that causes the current algorithm to count those
locations as if they were allocating space.

Besides this bug, it makes sense to not load deleted images from the
database if we're actually not considering them as valid images.

Change-Id: I82f08a8f522c81541e4f77597c2ba0aeb68556ce

commit_message:
Filter out deleted images from storage usage

All database API's currently include deleted images in the calc of
storage usage. This is not an issue when deleted images don't have
locations. However, there are cases where a deleted image has deleted
locations as well and that causes the current algorithm to count those
locations as if they were allocating space.

Besides this bug, it makes sense to not load deleted / killed /
pending_delete images from the database if we're actually not
considering them as valid images.

The patch also filters out deleted locations.

NOTE: In the case of locations, it was not possible to add a test for
the deleted locations because it requires some changes that are not
worth in this patch. In order to mark a location as deleted, it's
necessary to go through the API and use a PATCH operation. Since this is
a database test, it doesn't make much sense to add API calls to it.
Calling the image_destroy function with an empty location list will
remove all the locations which won't help testing that specific case.

I'll work on a better solution for that in a follow-up patch.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I82f08a8f522c81541e4f77597c2ba0aeb68556ce
Closes-Bug: #1261738

commit_message:
Handle the metrics sent by nova notifier

Nova compute node can now get metrics from monitors and send
notifications to message bus. So, add listeners to handle the
metrics in ceilometer. This patch changes the directory layout
for compute notifications, because there will be other metrics
(e.g. network and cache Qos) to be added. The deployer can also
add the metrics they want. It's better to make a classification
of these metrics.

Nova blueprint utilization-aware-scheduling

Change-Id: I6f54ef18035c437370360bbaff6d71666d0323fe

added_lines: # Which metrics to use for ceilometer,metrics_update_confmust # be configured to a fixed format:"name+unit+type".The name is # meter id(e.g.:cpu.percent) The unit is the description of # the unit of measurement.The type must be one of the meters # defined in ceilometer(gauge,delta,cumulative).Three # elements(name,unit,type)are essential and use the "+" # linking. (list value) #metrics_update_conf=cpu.kernel.time+seconds+cumulative,cpu.user.percent+%+gauge
